snippet: Omar Rodríguez Saludes called himself "a blind photographer," since he never saw prints of his work. His photos, which showed another side of Cuba, led to a prison sentence and his exile.
abstract: Omar Rodríguez Saludes called himself "a blind photographer," since he never saw prints of his work. His photos, which showed another side of Cuba, led to a prison sentence and his exile.

headline.main: For an Exiled Cuban Photographer, Freedom Was in Color
